cyclone.name: IDA
cyclone.current_location: about 510 mi SE of New Orleans, LA and 185 mi WNW of Havana, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest across the east-central Gulf of Mexico, forecast to curve slightly north and make landfall on the southeast Louisiana coast, then track north-northeast through Louisiana into western Mississippi
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeast Louisiana near the Mouth of the Mississippi River / Grand Isle area

weather_observation.watch_coast: Mouth of the Pearl River to the Mississippi/Alabama border
weather_observation.warning_coast: Mouth of the Pearl River to the Mississippi/Alabama border
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from Morgan City, LA eastward to the Alabama/Florida border, including the entire Mississippi Coast
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–73 mph) increasingly likely Sunday morning with a 73 % cumulative chance; hurricane-force gusts (≥74 mph) cannot be ruled out if the core tracks slightly east.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Inundation of 4–7 ft possible along the Mississippi coast from the mouth of the Mississippi River eastward to the MS/AL border, including Pascagoula Bay.
weather_observation.rainfall: 8–16 inches with locally up to 20 inches across southern Mississippi, producing significant flash and river flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes Sunday through early Monday; dangerous surf and rip currents beginning late Saturday.
